intro: Pluchea imbricata, commonly known as the creeping groundsel, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is a low-growing herbaceous species that typically forms dense mats on the ground. The plant features small, yellowish-green composite flowers arranged in clusters, which are characteristic of the Asteraceae family. Its leaves are usually opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs. Pluchea imbricata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks.
